alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Scott; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Woodford, southern Scott and northern Fayette Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Versailles, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Meadowthorpe and Cardinal Hill around 1230 PM EDT. Lexington and Highlands around 1235 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Thoroughbred Acres, Northland and Georgetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
